ags:resource.dc:title: Effect of sodium chloride on the germination of the seeds of a collection of carrot accessions (Daucus carota L.) cultivated in the region of Sidi Bouzid

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Seeds of ten accessions of carrot (Daucus carota L.) collected from seven areas in the region of Sidi Bouzid, Lessouda (three accessions: L1, L2 and L3) Faid (one accession: F4), El Ogla (one accession: E5), Regueb (two accessions: R7 and R8), Lahweze (one accession: L10) Garet Hdid (one accession: G11) and Souk Jedid (one accession: S12) were germinated at 20Â° C in the dark and in the presence of NaCl (0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14 and 16 g/l) during 14 days. The results obtained showed that germination is possible until the highest concentration of salt (16 g/l) but germination and speed of germination decrease according to the concentration, so the accession L3 was the most tolerant and accessions L1, L2 and S12 was the most sensitive.
